intro: Microstylis spicata, commonly known as the spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland environments in North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of pale brown to reddish flowers. Microstylis spicata typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, making it an important component of wetland ecosystems. Its botanical structure supports a variety of aquatic and terrestrial wildlife, contributing to biodiversity in its habitat.
